Greetings to Queen of Denmark
articles.content:
Greetings to Queen of Denmark
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, yesterday sent a message of greetings to queen of Denmark Margrethe ii on the occasion of its national day.
 Extending warm congratulations to the queen and people of Denmark on the occasion of its national day, the birthday of the queen, the message sincerely wished good health and happiness to her and prosperity to the people of Denmark.

Successes of DPRK Judoists at Asian championship
articles.content:
Successes of DPRK Judoists at Asian championship
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Ri Kyong Ok took the first place in the women's 48 kg category at the 14th Asian Judo Championship held in Ulaan Baatar, according to a news report.
 She was selected as the best player at the championship.    
 And Ri Myong Hwa placed second in the women's 57 kg category, Ji Kyong Sun and Won Yong Chol third in the wemen's 63 kg and men's 66 kg categories.

Greetings to Zimbabwean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Zimbabwean President
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 13 sent a message of greetings to President Robert G. Mugabe on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of the foundation of the Republic of Zimbabwe.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, the government and people of Zimbabwe on this occasion.    
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would invariably grow stronger and develop, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Zimbabwe greater success in their work to defend the sovereignty of the country and interests of the nation.

articles.title: WPK delegation leaves for Vietnam
articles.content:
WPK delegation leaves for Vietnam 
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Choe Thae Bok, alternate member of the political bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, left here today to participate in the 9th Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
 It was seen off at the airport by Pak Yong Sok, chairman of the central control commission of the WPK, and Do Thi Hoa, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Talks between delegations of WPK and New Communist Party of Great Britain
articles.content:
Talks between delegations of WPK and New Communist Party of Great Britain
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the New Communist Party of Great Britain took place in Pyongyang today.
 At the talks, the two sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on developing friendly relations between the two parties and on a series of matters of common concern.    
 Present at the talks were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned and members of the delegation of the New Communist Party of Great Britain headed by General Secretary Andy Brooks.
